name: Lactobacillus rhamnosus
summary: Lactobacillus rhamnosus is a probiotic strain with emerging evidence for supporting mood, reducing anxiety, and improving gut-brain communication, particularly the GG strain (LGG).
description: Lactobacillus rhamnosus is a probiotic bacterium widely used in dietary supplements and functional foods. The best-studied strain, *L. rhamnosus GG* (ATCC 53103), has been linked to gut health, immune modulation, and possible effects on stress resilience, anxiety, and mood regulation. Animal studies suggest mechanisms involving γ-aminobutyric acid (GABA) receptor modulation and vagus nerve signaling. Early human studies indicate potential benefits for stress and anxiety, though clinical evidence is still limited and strain-specific.

primary_indications: Support for digestive and immune health
off_label_uses: Adjunct for depression and stress-related mood disorders
contraindications: Severe immunocompromise (risk of systemic infection, rare)

sections.text: Lactobacillus rhamnosus influences the gut-brain axis by modulating gut microbiota, producing neuroactive metabolites, and signaling via the vagus nerve. The GG strain has been shown in preclinical studies to increase expression of GABA receptors in the brain, suggesting a role in reducing anxiety and regulating mood.

adult.typical: 1–10 billion CFU daily, with LGG strain most studied
adult.note: Doses vary by brand and formulation.

sections.pediatric: 1–5 billion CFU daily, commonly used in children for immune and gut support.

sections.text: Gut health benefits may appear within days to weeks; stress and mood effects may require 3–4 weeks of consistent use.

serious: Rare systemic infection in severely immunocompromised individuals

other: Effects are strain-dependent; not all L. rhamnosus strains have mental health benefits.
Avoid in severely immunocompromised patients without medical supervision.
Not a replacement for psychiatric treatment.

sections.pregnancy: Generally considered safe; often included in prenatal probiotics
sections.lactation: Safe and may support maternal and infant gut microbiota
sections.pediatrics: Well-studied for gut and immune health; mental health effects less studied
sections.geriatrics: Safe and beneficial for microbiota diversity

sections.text: No tapering required; discontinuation leads to gradual loss of colonization.

items: The *L. rhamnosus GG* strain is the most researched, with evidence for gut health and stress resilience.
Animal studies suggest anxiolytic effects via GABA receptor modulation, but human studies are limited.
Clinical benefits for mood are modest compared to standard therapies, but supplementation is generally safe.

seo.title: Lactobacillus rhamnosus – Probiotic for Gut Health, Stress, and Anxiety
seo.description: Lactobacillus rhamnosus (LGG strain) is a probiotic studied for gut health, immune support, and potential mood and anxiety benefits via the gut-brain axis. Learn about its benefits, dosage, and safety.
